symptoms.name: Fever
symptoms.severity: Variable, can be profound in profoundly neutropenic patients
symptoms.pattern: May be the only presenting symptom in some cases

symptoms.name: Cough
symptoms.pattern: May or may not be present

symptoms.name: Dyspnea
symptoms.pattern: May or may not be present

lab_values.beta-D-glucan (BDG): Elevated in BAL and tracheal aspirate; serum BDG not a reliable predictor, may be positive in other fungal infections

risk_factors: Hospital or intensive care unit stay

imaging_findings.Chest X-ray: Nonspecific findings; may show bronchopneumonia, nodular opacities, lung abscess, or cavitary lesions
imaging_findings.CT-thorax: Most common finding is the presence of nodules

diagnostic_criteria.required: Histopathological demonstration of Candida species in lung tissue along with evidence of inflammation
supportive: Isolation of Candida from respiratory samples (BAL/tracheal aspirate)
